result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary Dewayne Mitchell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gary Dewayne Mitchell in court.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Gary Dewayne Mitchell.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea and sentencing. Due to court congestions, court was unable to address the case. Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
Court is down and unable to hear this case.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case scheduled for 10/27/2022 at 3:00 pm for Plea and Sentencing, Courthouse Room 623.

Defendant Gary Dewayne Mitchell in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for Status Conference. 
Discussion held.  Defense  request a plea and sentencing date. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. 
Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Gary Dewayne Mitchell in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant has a pending felony matter in Branch 35 and defense has a global offer but need a separate offer for this case.
State will follow up. Court ordered matter adjourned. This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: 
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79. 
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gary Dewayne Mitchell in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a status.
Defense in receipt of discovery but does not have an offer. Defense requests an adjournment to allow time to receive an offer. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  
  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gary Dewayne Mitchell in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for scheduling l conference. 
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation  Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  
Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Douglas Rebholz  to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $45 Per Month. Repayment to begin 30 Days after the conclusion of the case.  
Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment.  Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel. . 
This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: 
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79. 
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:43 pm.
Court orders the $300.00 signature bond resinstated. All other conditions of bail to remain.
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 3-21-2022 at 8:30, Branch 19.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($300.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 300.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Gary Dewayne Mitchell not in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM  Case in court for a Pretrial Conference. DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. 
Court ordered Bench Warrant Issued. Remand to Commissioner  and forfeiture of bond.
Pre-trial conference on March 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Gary Dewayne Mitchell in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Gary Dewayne Mitchell in custody.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Gary Dewayne Mitchell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
